title: How to Remove Hair from the Arms

steps.title: Shave your arms using shaving foam, shaving cream or even hair conditioner and a razor.
steps.content: Shave your arms using shaving foam, shaving cream or even hair conditioner and a razor. This method is only temporary and hair starts to grow back in 1 to 3 days.

steps.title: Apply shaving foam or shaving cream.
steps.content: Apply shaving foam or shaving cream.

steps.title: Using a razor, shave arms in the opposite direction of hair growth.
steps.content: Using a razor, shave arms in the opposite direction of hair growth.

steps.title: Moisturize to make sure your skin doesn't dry or become irritated.
steps.content: Moisturize to make sure your skin doesn't dry or become irritated. [1] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source

steps.title: Buy waxing kits.
steps.content: Buy waxing kits. Choose a kit such as Veet to wax your own arms at home. Alternatively, you can get them done at a salon. This method is temporary and usually lasts between 1 and 4 weeks. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Buy hair removal creams from most drugstores and places that sell waxing kits.
steps.content: Buy hair removal creams from most drugstores and places that sell waxing kits.

steps.title: Apply the cream to your arms.
steps.content: Apply the cream to your arms.

steps.title: Leave on for the allotted time.
steps.content: Leave on for the allotted time. (Check the packaging.)

steps.title: Wash off the cream as instructed by the packaging.
steps.content: Wash off the cream as instructed by the packaging. The hair usually grows back within 7 days.

steps.title: Purchase an epilator.
steps.content: Purchase an epilator. Epilators can be bought in places that sell electric items, such as hair dryers. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Follow the instructions on the box carefully.
steps.content: Follow the instructions on the box carefully. This lasts for up to 4 weeks. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Use a laser hair removal treatment.
steps.content: Use a laser hair removal treatment. [5] X Expert Source Heather Richmond, MD Board Certified Dermatologist Expert Interview. 24 September 2020. This is available at some salons and plastic surgeries. Multiple sessions are required in order to achieve permanent hair removal. [6] X Expert Source Karina Villalta Certified Esthetician Expert Interview. 19 August 2020. Note that this can be fairly expensive, but is usually permanent. [7] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source This doesn't work well on white or blonde hair.

steps.title: Try electrolysis.
steps.content: Try electrolysis. [8] X Expert Source Heather Richmond, MD Board Certified Dermatologist Expert Interview. 24 September 2020. Electrolysis is available at some salons and plastic surgeries. Electrolysis is a hair removal method that includes a tiny needle being inserted into each hair follicle to destroy the root with an electric pulse. It is most recommended for smaller areas because it takes a long time. Usually need treatment every 1 or 2 weeks until the hair is gone.

steps.title: Patch test the product on a small area of your arm for around 15 minutes.
steps.content: Patch test the product on a small area of your arm for around 15 minutes. If it irritates your skin, do not continue to use it. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Apply a body hair waxing kit to the area and apply for the stated time.
steps.content: Apply a body hair waxing kit to the area and apply for the stated time. (Usually around 10 minutes).

steps.title: Remove a small amount of the product from a small area to check if it's done.
steps.content: Remove a small amount of the product from a small area to check if it's done. If not, cover the patch back up and leave on for around 5 minutes.

steps.title: Use cool water to rinse the skin.
steps.content: Use cool water to rinse the skin. This will get rid of the bleach.

steps.title: Moisturize the skin to stop it from becoming dry or cracked.
steps.content: Moisturize the skin to stop it from becoming dry or cracked. [11] X Research source
